messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI Bmad Nodes collection?

The ComfyUI Bmad Nodes collection provides a miscellaneous assortment of custom nodes for ComfyUI, which can be used for various applications such as setting up API requests, computer vision tasks, and general utility functions.
What are the main categories of nodes in the ComfyUI Bmad Nodes collection?
The main categories of nodes in the ComfyUI Bmad Nodes collection are: api, computer vision, and general utility.
What does the 'String' node in the ComfyUI Bmad Nodes collection do?

The 'String' node in the ComfyUI Bmad Nodes collection is used to create a string (text) node, which can be written before connecting to another node or if some custom node does not work properly with the PrimitiveNode.
What is the purpose of the 'MonoMerge' node in the ComfyUI Bmad Nodes collection?
The 'MonoMerge' node in the ComfyUI Bmad Nodes collection is used to select the maximum (or minimum) value between two images, mainly used for mask composition.
How does the 'AdjustRect' node in the ComfyUI Bmad Nodes collection work?

The 'AdjustRect' node in the ComfyUI Bmad Nodes collection receives a rectangle and returns a new rectangle that shares the same center but with width adjusted to a multiple of 'xm' and height to a multiple of 'ym'. Setting 'round_mode' to 'exact' will return a rectangle with the exact defined dimensions.
What is the purpose of the 'Conditioning Grid (cond)' node in the ComfyUI Bmad Nodes collection?

The 'Conditioning Grid (cond)' node in the ComfyUI Bmad Nodes collection creates conditioning areas of size 'width'x'height', forming a grid of 'columns'x'rows' conditioning areas. The inputs notation can be read as: r{row}_c{column}. 'strength' is the strength to be applied in all the areas, and 'base' is the base conditioning prior to setting the tiles conditioning.
What is the purpose of the 'CV' (Computer Vision) nodes in the ComfyUI Bmad Nodes collection?
The 'CV' (Computer Vision) nodes in the ComfyUI Bmad Nodes collection use or expose openCV functionalities for various computer vision tasks.
